name: GIST Rectum T
title: Clinical and Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:** TNM does not include an in situ category for GIST tumors. Assign TX and behavior code /2 for in situ cases.

**Note 2:**  Ignore intraluminal extension to adjacent segment(s) of colon; code depth of invasion or extra-appendiceal spread as indicated.

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign a T value. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If no tumor size is available, assign TX.

**Note 4:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

**All sites**

    Invasive tumor in polyp, NOS
    Tumor confined to muscular wall
    Tumor invades through submucosa and muscularis mucosae to involve mucosa

    Extension through  wall, NOS
    Intraluminal extension to rectosigmoid (rectum only)
    Intraluminal extension to anus (rectum only)
    Invasion through muscularis propria or muscularis, NOS
    Invasion of/through serosa (mesothelium) (visceral peritoneum)
    Invasion of/through serosa with invasion of/through mucosa
    Non-peritonealized pericolic tissues invaded
    Perimuscular tissue invaded
    Subserosal tissue/(sub)serosal fat invaded
    Transmural, NOS
    Wall, NOS

    Confined to rectosigmoid
    Confined to rectum
    Localized, NOS

**All sites**

    Adherent to liver capsule
    Adherent to other organs or structures, NOS
    Bladder
    Cul de sac (rectouterine pouch)
    Fat, NOS
    Other segments of colon via serosa
    Ovary(ies)
    Pelvic wall    
    Perirectal fat
    Prostate
    Skeletal muscles of pelvic floor
    Uterus
    Vagina
      
**Rectosigmoid (C19.9)**

    Colon via serosa
    Fallopian tube(s)
    Mesentery (including mesenteric fat, mesocolon)
    Pericolic fat
    Pelvic plexuses
    Small intestine
    Ureter(s)
    

**Rectum (C20.9)**

    Anus (excluding intraluminal extension)
    Bone(s) of pelvis
    Colon
    Ductus deferens
    Perineum, perianal skin
    Rectovaginal septum
    Rectovesical fascia for males only
    Sacral plexus
    Sacrum
    Seminal vesicle(s)
    Urethra
